bioghist.p: Arthur W. Silver was the author of Manchester Men and Indian Cotton, 1847-1872. He served on the faculty of Temple University.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of papers resulting from Silver's work in the summer of 1939 when he was photographing materials for his Harvard doctoral thesis "British Effort to Secure an Empire Cotton Supply, 1842-1872." Materials include: film of documents from India Office Archive, the Public Records office, the British Museum, and the Manchester Public Library; film of correspondence, memos, tracts, financial documents, company records and reports (numbering on film reels runs from 199 through 639 -- not all numbers are present); an index card file lists detailed contents of each reel; a photocopy of inventory of reels; and a ledger listing microfilm reels that were deposited at Temple.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
